snippet: Kenneth P. Thompson, who represents the hotel housekeeper who accused Dominique Strauss-Kahn of sexual assault, is challenging the incumbent Charles J. Hynes.
abstract: Kenneth P Thompson, a prominent lawyer who has been involved in some of New York City’s most controversial criminal cases, says he intends to run for Brooklyn district attorney; move would expand the field running against Charles J. Hynes, a longtime incumbent whose hold on the office has weakened amid mounting criticism.
lead_paragraph: Kenneth P. Thompson, who represents the hotel housekeeper who accused Dominique Strauss-Kahn of sexual assault, is challenging the incumbent Charles J. Hynes.

headline.seo: Hynes Faces Re-election Fight From Lawyer in Strauss-Kahn Case
headline.main: Brooklyn District Attorney Has a New Rival
headline.print_headline: Brooklyn District Attorney Has a New Rival
